dlentry.dt: My MySQL JDBC Driver 5.0 fails to validate the query in my JBDC origin.
dlentry.dd: This can occur when you use a LIMIT clause in your query. Workaround: Upgrade to version 5.1.

dlentry.dt: I'm using the JDBC origin to read MySQL data. Why are datetime value set to zero being treated like error records?
dlentry.dd: MySQL treats invalid dates as an exception, so the JDBC origin creates error records for invalid dates. You can override this behavior by setting a JDBC configuration property in the JDBC origin. Add the zeroDateTimeBehavior property and set the value to "convertToNull".
For more information about this and other MySQL-specific JDBC configuration properties, see http://dev.mysql.com/doc/connector-j/en/connector-j-reference-configuration-properties.html.
